adm:managed-object.name: http-oauth2-token-introspection-authorization-mechanism
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis:
The
is used to define OAuth2 authorization using an introspection (RFC7662) compliant authorization server.

adm:property-override.name: authzid-json-pointer
adm:property-override.adm:synopsis: Specifies the JSON pointer to the value to use as Authorization ID. The JSON pointer is applied to the resolved access token JSON document. (example: sub)

adm:property.name: token-introspection-url
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Defines the token introspection endpoint URL where the access-token resolution request should be sent. (example: http://example.com/introspect)

adm:property.name: client-id
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Client's ID to use during the HTTP basic authentication against the authorization server.

adm:property.name: client-secret
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Client's secret to use during the HTTP basic authentication against the authorization server.

adm:property.name: key-manager-provider
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
Specifies the name of the key manager that should be used with this
.

adm:none.adm:synopsis: Changes to this property take effect immediately, but only for subsequent requests to the authorization server.

adm:constraint.adm:synopsis: The referenced key manager provider must be enabled.

adm:property.name: trust-manager-provider
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the name of the trust manager that should be used when negotiating SSL connections with the remote authorization server.

adm:none.adm:synopsis: Changes to this property take effect immediately, but only impact subsequent SSL connection negotiations.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: By default, no trust manager is specified indicating that only certificates signed by the authorities associated with this JVM will be accepted.

adm:constraint.adm:synopsis: The referenced trust manager provider must be enabled when SSL is enabled.
